Reason: The configuration option 'cdc_free_space_check_interval_ms' in the Cassandra project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the interval at which the system checks for free space in the commit log directory. A lower value for this configuration can result in more frequent checks, potentially leading to increased system overhead and resource consumption. Conversely, a higher value may delay necessary checks, impacting the system's ability to efficiently manage commit log space. Therefore, changes to this configuration can significantly affect system performance in terms of execution time and resource utilization.
